description:
Genetic engineering (or genetic modification, transgenic) is to modify genetic
materials of living things according to human’s will. Is it beneficial or harmful?
Are you aware of GMO (genetically modified organism) and GM food? Do you
want to favour or oppose these GM products? Should we modify the gene for
curing genetic diseases? Is it acceptable to use genetically modified animals for
organ transplantation to human? Do you know that genetic modification can
actually help to save the environment? This module will help students to
understand the science behind genetic engineering and thus students can
make educated answers to the above questions. There are plenty of examples
of genetic engineering and each student needs to choose one or few examples
and try to understand how these products have been created; their benefits and
potential hazards, if any, will be discussed in the class.
title: FS: Genetic Engineering
